attributes.action: Recognise the seriousness of Hidradenitis suppurativa and make DWP recognise it
attributes.additional_details:
I suffer from Stage 3 Hidradenitis suppurativa, I used to be a very active person. 
Being able to go rock climbing, lifting weights, I was in the military I fought for my country. 
Now I can barely dress myself I have difficulty sleeping, boils hurt so much that even painkillers don't help. 
Non-stop pus and blood makes me uncomfortable around people, I have anxiety, depression, I am simply a completely different person I used to be. Im still young and I'd love to enjoy my life!
attributes.background: Recognise the seriousness of this illness, provide support to those suffering from stage 3, understand that invisible condition like this has a massive effect on people mental health and physical ability

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about Hidradenitis suppurativa and how it is considered during assessments for Personal Independent Payment (PIP). However the Personal Independence Payment is paid to people who have a health condition or disability which causes difficulties with daily living or getting around. PIP is paid based on the difficulties causes by a health condition or disability, but there are not particular conditions which result in PIP being paid. You can read more about eligibility for PIP here: https://www.gov.uk/pip/eligibility

If Hidradenitis suppurativa causes difficulties with daily living or getting around, a sufferer could claim for PIP in the same way as someone with another health condition or disability.
